description: A host asks for diverse tech entrepreneurship guests, the AI analyzes past episodes and audience data, searches for under‑represented experts, ranks them, and generates a personalized outreach email.

messages.content: You are PodMatch AI, an agentic assistant that helps podcast hosts find ideal guests. Use the provided tools to fetch podcast metadata, analyze audience interests, search expert profiles, rank candidates, and generate guest outreach pitches.

Hi! I'm Jordan Lee, host of the "FutureTech Talk" podcast. I want to plan three upcoming episodes that highlight under‑represented voices in tech entrepreneurship. Can you suggest some guests who would bring diverse perspectives?

Sure thing, Jordan! To recommend guests that fit your goal, I’ll first look at your recent episodes to see what topics you’ve covered and who you’ve hosted before. Then I’ll need a snapshot of your audience analytics to understand what your listeners are most interested in. Let’s start by fetching your podcast metadata.

Fetching metadata from your RSS feed...

[{"title":"AI in Healthcare","guest_name":"Dr. Emily Zhang","guest_demographics":{"gender":"female","ethnicity":"Asian"},"topics":["AI","Healthcare"]},{"title":"FinTech Disruption","guest_name":"Carlos Mendes","guest_demographics":{"gender":"male","ethnicity":"Latino"},"topics":["FinTech","Disruption"]},{"title":"Women in Gaming","guest_name":"Sarah Collins","guest_demographics":{"gender":"female","ethnicity":"White"},"topics":["Women in Gaming"]},{"title":"Crypto Regulations","guest_name":"Dr. Ahmed Khalid","guest_demographics":{"gender":"male","ethnicity":"Middle Eastern"},"topics":["Crypto","Regulations"]},{"title":"Sustainable Energy Startups","guest_name":"Maya Patel","guest_demographics":{"gender":"female","ethnicity":"South Asian"},"topics":["Sustainable Energy","Startups"]}]

Got the episode data! Your recent shows have covered AI, healthcare, fintech, gaming, crypto, and sustainable energy, with a mix of guest demographics but still room to amplify Black, Latinx, LGBTQ+, and women-of‑color voices.

Please provide a sample of your audience analytics (CSV or JSON) so I can pinpoint the topics your listeners care about most.
Here’s the latest audience analytics (JSON): [{"category":"Tech Startups","sessions":1200},{"category":"Diversity & Inclusion","sessions":800},{"category":"AI & Machine Learning","sessions":950}]

Thanks! I’ll extract the top interest categories.

Analyzing audience interests...

Great, your audience is keen on tech startups, diversity & inclusion, and AI/ML.

Next, I’ll search for experts who match a blend of these topics **and** represent under‑represented groups in tech entrepreneurship. I’ll include keywords like "women founders", "Black tech entrepreneur", "Latinx startup founder", and "LGBTQ+ tech leader" alongside the core topics.

Searching expert profiles...

[{"name":"Dr. Aisha Rahman","affiliation":"Professor of Entrepreneurship, Northwestern University","bio":"Black female scholar focusing on inclusive innovation ecosystems.","email":"aisha.rahman@northwestern.edu","recent_work":"https://doi.org/10.1000/inhinc2023"},{"name":"Luis Gomez","affiliation":"Co‑founder & CEO, GreenTech Solutions","bio":"Latinx entrepreneur pioneering clean‑tech startups.","email":"l.gomez@greentech.com","recent_work":"https://greentech.com/press"},{"name":"Priya Singh","affiliation":"CEO, HealthAI Labs","bio":"Indian‑American leader in AI‑driven healthcare startups.","email":"priya.singh@healthai.com","recent_work":"https://healthai.com/blog"},{"name":"Jordan Rivera","affiliation":"Founder, QueerTech Hub","bio":"LGBTQ+ activist and tech community builder.","email":"j.rivera@queertech.org","recent_work":"https://queertech.org/events"},{"name":"Dr. Maya Liu","affiliation":"Associate Professor, Stanford University","bio":"Women of color researcher in sustainable energy entrepreneurship.","email":"maya.liu@stanford.edu","recent_work":"https://scholar.google.com/maya_liu"}]

I’ve gathered a set of promising candidates. Now I’ll rank them against your past episode topics and the audience interests you shared.

Ranking candidates...

candidates.name: Dr. Aisha Rahman
candidates.bio: Black female scholar focusing on inclusive innovation ecosystems.

candidates.name: Priya Singh
candidates.bio: Indian‑American leader in AI‑driven healthcare startups.

candidates.name: Jordan Rivera
candidates.bio: LGBTQ+ activist and tech community builder.

candidates.name: Dr. Maya Liu
candidates.bio: Women of color researcher in sustainable energy entrepreneurship.

messages.content: [{"name":"Dr. Aisha Rahman","suitability":92.4,"bio":"Black female scholar focusing on inclusive innovation ecosystems.","email":"aisha.rahman@northwestern.edu"},{"name":"Luis Gomez","suitability":87.1,"bio":"Latinx entrepreneur pioneering clean‑tech startups.","email":"l.gomez@greentech.com"},{"name":"Jordan Rivera","suitability":84.6,"bio":"LGBTQ+ activist and tech community builder.","email":"j.rivera@queertech.org"}]

Here are the top three guests who align strongly with your themes and bring under‑represented perspectives:

1. **Dr. Aisha Rahman** (92% match) – Black female professor of entrepreneurship, expert on inclusive innovation ecosystems.
2. **Luis Gomez** (87% match) – Latinx clean‑tech startup founder, experienced in scaling sustainable tech businesses.
3. **Jordan Rivera** (85% match) – LGBTQ+ tech community activist and founder of QueerTech Hub.

Which of these would you like to invite first? I can generate a personalized pitch email for the selected guest.
Let’s start with Dr. Aisha Rahman. Please draft the outreach email.
Creating a personalized pitch for Dr. Aisha Rahman...

arguments.guest_bio: Black female scholar focusing on inclusive innovation ecosystems.
arguments.episode_theme: Breaking Barriers: Diversity in Tech Entrepreneurship

messages.content:
Subject: Invitation to Join "FutureTech Talk" – Episode on Diversity in Tech Entrepreneurship

Hi Dr. Rahman,

I’m Jordan Lee, host of the "FutureTech Talk" podcast, where we explore cutting‑edge trends and the people shaping tomorrow’s tech landscape.

I’ve been following your groundbreaking research on inclusive innovation ecosystems, especially your recent study on how under‑represented founders secure funding. Your insights would be incredibly valuable for our upcoming episode titled **"Breaking Barriers: Diversity in Tech Entrepreneurship"**, which aims to spotlight the challenges and successes of Black women leaders in tech.

Given your expertise and inspiring career, I believe you’d provide our listeners with a nuanced perspective that aligns perfectly with the themes we’ve covered (AI, sustainable tech, and startup growth) while also addressing the diversity & inclusion focus that resonates strongly with our audience.

Would you be interested in joining us for a 30‑minute conversation? We record remotely at a time that works best for you and can accommodate any scheduling preferences you have.

Thank you for considering this invitation. I look forward to the possibility of featuring your voice on the show.

Best regards,
Jordan Lee
Host, FutureTech Talk
jordan@futuretechtalk.com

Here’s the draft email you can send to Dr. Aisha Rahman:

---

**Subject:** Invitation to Join "FutureTech Talk" – Episode on Diversity in Tech Entrepreneurship

Hi Dr. Rahman,

I’m Jordan Lee, host of the "FutureTech Talk" podcast, where we explore cutting‑edge trends and the people shaping tomorrow’s tech landscape.

I’ve been following your groundbreaking research on inclusive innovation ecosystems, especially your recent study on how under‑represented founders secure funding. Your insights would be incredibly valuable for our upcoming episode titled **"Breaking Barriers: Diversity in Tech Entrepreneurship"**, which aims to spotlight the challenges and successes of Black women leaders in tech.

Given your expertise and inspiring career, I believe you’d provide our listeners with a nuanced perspective that aligns perfectly with the themes we’ve covered (AI, sustainable tech, and startup growth) while also addressing the diversity & inclusion focus that resonates strongly with our audience.

Would you be interested in joining us for a 30‑minute conversation? We record remotely at a time that works best for you and can accommodate any scheduling preferences you have.

Thank you for considering this invitation. I look forward to the possibility of featuring your voice on the show.

Best regards,
Jordan Lee
Host, FutureTech Talk
jordan@futuretechtalk.com

---

Let me know if you’d like any tweaks or if you’d like me to draft pitches for the other candidates as well.
